section_name: prohibitions quantitative restrictions licensing and prior authorization
text: ['3.1.4  Prohibitions, quantitative restrictions, licensing and prior authorization', '3.58.  All imports from Israel are banned.39', '3.59.  The  products  whose  importation  may  be  prohibited  or  restricted  form  the  subject  of  a 1994 law  on  "exclusion  from  the  free  import  regime".40  The  list  of  products  excluded  from  the regime has not changed since 2001. The relevant notifications have been submitted to the WTO.41', "3.60.  According to the authorities, the goods currently excluded from the free import regime have been listed for reasons of security, public order, health, morality, or to protect fauna and flora and the  country's  cultural  heritage.42  There  are  more  than  800  lines  (at  9-digit  HS  level)  in  the  list, corresponding to some 7.2% of all tariff lines (Table 3.10).", '38 The 1995 Barcelona Declaration established a Euro-Mediterranean partnership based on three', 'chapters for cooperation: political dialogue; economic relations (including free trade); and human, social and cultural relations.', '39 GATT document L/6713 of 27 July 1990. 40 Law No. 94-41 of 7 March 1994 on foreign trade. 41 WTO documents G/LIC/N/1/TUN/2 of 11 January 2007 and G/LIC/N/1/TUN/2/Corr.1 of', '14 February 2007.', '42 Decree No. 94-1742 of 29 August 1994 setting out the lists of products excluded from the free foreign', 'trade regime, viewed at: http://www.anticor.tn/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/decrets/jo06994.pdf. According to a recent study, however, in order to contain the trade deficit, imports of motor vehicles are subject to annual quotas, allocated to concessionaires by the Ministry of Trade, according, inter alia, to their purchases of automotive equipment from local component manufacturers (Oxford Business Group (2016)).', '\x0cWT/TPR/S/341 • Tunisia', '- 55 -', 'Table 3.10 Products excluded from Products not subject to restrictions in 2005. For 2005, the number of tariff lines affected are at the 11-digit level; for 2016, the number of lines affected are at the 9-digit level.', '\x0cWT/TPR/S/341 • Tunisia', '- 56 -', '3.61.  Products  excluded  from  free  importation  require  an  import  authorization  (non-automatic licence). Two days are required to obtain a licence, but the time varies depending on the product and the urgent nature of the transaction.43 These requirements do not apply to wholly exporting industries,  which  may  freely  import  all  the  goods  needed  for  their  investment  and  production. Imports  of  products  subject  to  tariff  quotas  in  connection  with  the  minimum  market  access provisions  in  the  WTO  Agreement  on  Agriculture  are  administered  by  means  of  special authorizations (Section 4.1.6). In January 2016, special import authorizations at rates below the MFN rate were suspended for the import of 0% fat content dried milk, frozen and chilled red meat and calves for fattening.']
